KG developed it in cooperation with the #RECLAIM team. #Refurbishment through #digitalization is the keyword. They have #retrofitted their friction welding head with various #sensors to record pressure, temperature, angle, and speed. These now provide valuable #data on the health of the machine for the first time. Despite its reluctance to change, the jewelry industry should look to technological solutions so that its supply chain can keep pace with changes in the economic landscape and consumer preferences and behavior. Read the full article: Digitization of the Supply Chain â–¸ Link in comment

Consumers of luxury products are becoming increasingly concerned with the ethics and sustainability of these products. As a result, the lab-grown diamond industry, valued at $19.3 billion in 2020, is expected to grow to nearly $50 billion by 2030, according to Allied Market Research. While the industry currently produces nearly equal numbers of CVD and HPHT diamonds today, the CVD method will become the preferred method of diamond growth in the next decade as it is less costly and more energy-efficient than HPHT, which requires larger equipment and higher temperatures and pressures. As the public receives more education on lab-grown diamonds, the method by which a diamond is grown may become a factor in a consumerâ€™s decision-making process. The Future of Diamond and Jewelry Manufacturing: Trends and Predictions â–¸ Link in comment

Register now for our upcoming webinar 'Funding for Innovation & Implementing new technologies' with Tony Boon from Luxury Lockstitch UK, the KTP team at De Montfort University and Sue Rainton from University of Leeds and Future Fashion Factory Our latest webinar in the Disrupting Manufacturing series will delve into crucial topics shaping the UK's funding landscape and how UK fashion and textile manufacturing businesses can leverage these opportunities for growth and innovation. ğŸ“… 26 March 2024, 10:30am-12:00pm ğŸ“ Online The session will cover: â†’ The UKâ€™s funding landscape for manufacturers, innovators and pioneers to explore the mechanisms available to support your initiatives and projects including some of the funding, programmes and grants available. â†’ How businesses can access funding for innovation development, including key strategies and best practices of how to maximise your chances of securing financial support. â†’ How working in partnership with academic institutions can drive innovation and implementation forward. â†’ How funding can unlock potential for increased competitive advantage and foster sustainable growth. UKFT members can email info@ukft.org to register for free. You can register here: https://lnkd.in/exqjwM9n #innovation #manufacturing #fashion #textiles

Despite its reluctance to change, the jewelry industry should look to technological solutions so that its supply chain can keep pace with changes in the economic landscape and consumer preferences and behavior. Read the full article: Digitization of the Supply Chain â–¸ Link in comment

On's Light Spray innovation has me thinking. How did a company 50% the size of Under Armour, 25% the size of Puma and 5% of Nike come up with something new and seemingly better than larger and more established competition? How does a risk mindset of a challenger brand stimulate innovation? What roles does company culture have in being open to innovation? How does "accepting risk" growth innovation opportunites? I don't have the answers for all these but have to say this innovation has me thinking differently about the brand. Having the idea is easy. Executing and making it real is hard. I respect On taking the risk. https://lnkd.in/gQM8CQBn --- Iâ€™m the owner of The Directive Collective footwear design consultancy. We make great footwear, not just great sketches. #design #footwear #footweardesign
